card.name: Akki Coalflinger
card.ability:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: No matter where you find them, goblins love rocks.

card.name: Allosaurus Rider
card.ability:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay Allosaurus Rider's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.
card.ruling:
7/15/2006 : Paying the alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast the spell. A creature spell you cast this way, for example, can still only be cast during your main phase while the stack is empty.
7/15/2006 : You may pay the alternative cost rather than the card's mana cost. Any additional costs are paid as normal.
7/15/2006 : If you don't have two cards of the right color in your hand, you can't choose to cast the spell using the alternative cost.
7/15/2006 : You can't exile a card from your hand to pay for itself. At the time you would pay costs, that card is on the stack, not in your hand.

card.name: Ambush Commander
card.ability:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Boggart Shenanigans
card.ability: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Boggarts revel in discovering new sensations, from the texture of an otter pellet to the squeak of a dying warren mate.

card.name: Clickslither
card.ability:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: The least popular goblins get the outer caves.

card.name: Elvish Eulogist
card.ability: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

card.name: Elvish Harbinger
card.ability:
When Elvish Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Elvish Promenade
card.ability: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield for each Elf you control.
card.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.

card.name: Elvish Warrior
card.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

card.name: Emberwilde Augur
card.ability: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: Emberwilde Augur deals 3 damage to target player. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.flavor: Legends say a djinn gave the goblins a gift they could never hope to master.

card.name: Flamewave Invoker
card.ability: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.

card.name: Forgotten Cave
card.ability:
Forgotten Cave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Gempalm Incinerator
card.ability:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The target of the ability can't be a creature with Protection from Creatures, with Protection from Goblins, or with Protection from Red.
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Gempalm Strider
card.ability:
Cycling {2}{G}{G} ({2}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Strider, Elf creatures get +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Goblin Burrows
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Goblin Cohort
card.ability: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
card.flavor: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.

card.name: Goblin Matron
card.ability: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: There's always room for one more.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
4/1/2008 : You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

card.name: Goblin Ringleader
card.ability:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Goblin Sledder
card.ability: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Let's play ‘sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."

card.name: Goblin Warchief
card.ability:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.
card.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

card.name: Harmonize
card.ability: Draw three cards.
card.flavor:
"Life's greatest lessons don't come from focus or concentration. They come from breathing and simply noticing."
—Seton, centaur druid
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : This is the timeshifted version of Concentrate.

card.name: Heedless One
card.ability:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Channel your vitality through me."

card.name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
card.ability:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If you don't actually sacrifice the Goblin (because it was removed from the battlefield before the ability resolved, for example), no damage is dealt.

card.name: Imperious Perfect
card.ability:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

card.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
card.ability: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

card.name: Mogg Fanatic
card.ability: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

card.name: Mogg War Marshal
card.ability:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Moonglove Extract
card.ability: Sacrifice Moonglove Extract: Moonglove Extract deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.

card.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
card.ability: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

card.name: Reckless One
card.ability:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Release chaos with me!"

card.name: Siege-Gang Commander
card.ability:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.
10/1/2009 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking Goblin during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that Goblin has been dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

card.name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
card.ability: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
card.flavor: "I order you to volunteer."

card.name: Skirk Fire Marshal
card.ability:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Skirk Prospector
card.ability: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner

card.name: Skirk Shaman
card.ability: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
card.flavor: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : This is the timeshifted version of Severed Legion.

card.name: Slate of Ancestry
card.ability: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.
card.flavor: The pattern of life can be studied like a book, if you know how to read it.

card.name: Spitting Earth
card.ability: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
card.flavor:
"Within each of you is the strength of a landslide."
—Kumano, to his pupils

card.name: Stonewood Invoker
card.ability: {7}{G}: Stonewood Invoker gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Mirari pulses in his veins.

card.name: Sylvan Messenger
card.ability:
Trample
When Sylvan Messenger enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Elf cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Tar Pitcher
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

card.name: Tarfire
card.ability: Tarfire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"After Auntie brushed the soot from her eyes, she discovered something wonderful: the fire had turned the goat into something that smelled delicious."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

card.name: Timberwatch Elf
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Even through the Mirari's voice, the elves still hear the call of their kinship.

card.name: Tranquil Thicket
card.ability:
Tranquil Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Voice of the Woods
card.ability: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Put a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The ritual of making draws upon the elves' memories and pasts. And elves have long memories and ancient pasts.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Wellwisher
card.ability: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Close your ears to the voice of greed, and you can turn a gift for one into a gift for many."

card.name: Wildsize
card.ability:
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Two times the size, four times the smell.

card.name: Wirewood Herald
card.ability: When Wirewood Herald dies, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The goblins laughed as the elf ran away, until more came back.

card.name: Wirewood Lodge
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Untap target Elf.

card.name: Wirewood Symbiote
card.ability: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: It drinks fatigue.

card.name: Wood Elves
card.ability: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Wren's Run Vanquisher
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Wren's Run Vanquisher, reveal an Elf card from your hand or pay {3}.
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
